intro: Minuartia rimarum, commonly known as the rock cress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with succulent stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It is often found growing on rocky soils in alpine and arctic regions. Minuartia rimarum is adapted to harsh environments and is typically found in crevices or on mountain slopes.
